subject: Art & Design
title: Fitts's Law: Size and Distance Matter for Clicks
description: Learn Fitts's Law: Size and Distance Matter for Clicks in one minute.

hook.text: Apple's dock icons are huge. Submit buttons are wide. Delete buttons are small. That's Fitts's Law in action.

buildup.text: Fitts's Law: the time to reach a target depends on its size and distance. Bigger, closer targets are faster to click.

discovery.text: Screen edges and corners have infinite size (you can't overshoot). That's why menus sit at the top and corners.

twist.text: Mobile design violates Fitts when it puts small tap targets near large ones. Accidental taps frustrate users constantly.

climax.text: Google's Material Design specifies minimum touch targets of 48Ã—48dp.

punchline.text: Make important things big and close. Make dangerous things small and far.

quiz.question: What does Fitts's Law predict about button design?
options: Larger, closer buttons are faster and easier to click or tap
All buttons should be the same size
Button color affects click speed more than size
